alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Owen; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:58PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Morgan, northeastern Owen and southeastern Putnam Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 757 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Greencastle, or 26 miles northwest of Bloomington, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Morgan, northeastern Owen and southeastern Putnam Counties, including the following locations... Eminence, Cloverdale, Devore and Quincy. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 41 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central and west central Indiana.
